pullRequest.body:
Adds the definition of Galois categories in the sense of SGA1 following notes by Lenstra.

---

nodes.body: Do you plan to define something called `GaloisCategory`? If not I don't see the point of having `PregaloisCategory`.

> Do you plan to define something called `GaloisCategory`? If not I don't see the point of having `PregaloisCategory`.

No, I don't. The reason why I called it `PreGaloisCategory` is because in the literature a `GaloisCategory` is usually understood as a `PreGaloisCategory` (in the above sense) either together with a fixed `FibreFunctor` or that admits a `FibreFunctor`.

So this notion of `PreGaloisCategory` is weaker than the usual notion of `GaloisCategory`. I choose this naming as in `IsPretransitive` which only encodes the transitivity of the action but not the non-emptiness.

> > Do you plan to define something called `GaloisCategory`? If not I don't see the point of having `PregaloisCategory`.
> 
> No, I don't. The reason why I called it `PreGaloisCategory` is because in the literature a `GaloisCategory` is usually understood as a `PreGaloisCategory` (in the above sense) either together with a fixed `FibreFunctor` or that admits a `FibreFunctor`.
> 
> So this notion of `PreGaloisCategory` is weaker than the usual notion of `GaloisCategory`. I choose this naming as in `IsPretransitive` which only encodes the transitivity of the action but not the non-emptiness.

OK, can you add in the docstring what one has to do to fix a Galois category in the usual sense? Like what is explained for `Pretransitive`. Thanks!

> OK, can you add in the docstring what one has to do to fix a Galois category in the usual sense? Like what is explained for `Pretransitive`. Thanks!

Done in the latest commit.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7474270567/job/20340078809)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7474270567/job/20340078237)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7474270567/job/20340079127)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion PreGaloisCategory.hasQuotientsByFiniteGroups G ```

```suggestion
  hasTerminal : HasTerminal C
```

Ah, also, for some of the fields, it could be useful to declare them like this
``  hasTerminal : HasTerminal C := by infer_instance``
because then, it will be easier to declare a `PreGaloisCategory` instance, as most of the fields would usually be filled automatically by typeclass inference.
I would suggest putting such instances in the `PregaloisCategory` namespace, and then it should be sufficient to add a line like `attribute [instance] hasTerminal hasPullbacks`, etc.
Do you also suggest to drop the `namespace Galois` then?

Yes. First, everything should be in the root `CategoryTheory` namespace. `PreGaloisCategory` should be just under `CategoryTheory`. Then, I would think most of the definitions in this file should be in `CategoryTheory.PreGaloisCategory`.
I think I changed it accordingly.

```suggestion
* `FibreFunctor`      : a fibre functor from any PreGalois category to `FintypeCat`
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): definition of Galois categories
